Class Utility

Contains various utility commands like sniping deleted messages, getting a list of roles with specific permissions, etc.

GetTraceRoute(string)

Generates the sequence of IP addresses representing the path taken to the specified hostname using ICMP echo requests.

Declaration
public static IEnumerable<IPAddress> GetTraceRoute(string hostname)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string hostname

The target hostname or IP address for the traceroute operation.
Returns
Type Description
IEnumerable<IPAddress>

An enumerable collection of IP addresses representing each hop in the route.
Remarks

This method sends ICMP packets with incrementing Time-to-Live (TTL) values to trace the route to the specified target. Each hop along the route decrements the TTL by one, and when it reaches zero, it responds with an ICMP "Time Exceeded" message, allowing the traceroute operation to identify each router or hop along the path. If the operation reaches the target or encounters an error before the maximum TTL, it terminates early.

| Edit this page View Source

Traceroute(string)

Executes a traceroute operation to the specified hostname, displaying the route that packets take to reach an IP address or domain.

Declaration
[Cmd("Traceroute")]
[Aliases("Traceroute")]
[Ratelimit(10)]
public Task Traceroute(string hostname)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string hostname

The IP address or domain name to trace the route to.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation of sending the traceroute results as a message.
Remarks

This command simulates the traceroute utility commonly found in Unix-based operating systems, tracing the path packets take to reach a network host. It's useful for diagnosing network issues by identifying points of failure or delay in the route to the target host. Due to the nature of ICMP protocol limitations and network configurations, some hops may not respond (e.g., due to firewalls), resulting in incomplete paths. The operation might take a while depending on the number of hops and network conditions, hence the bot will show a typing indicator during execution.

| Edit this page View Source
